TopicTitle: How do you post Images into the Fourm

Articles.Content:
Hi,

I am sorry if this is a dump question, but I would like to post some of my creations, and ideas into the fourm but when I go and click on the "Import Image", I am informed by the software that it can't update the image.

Why ?

Upload them to a proper image hosting site, like imgur, dropbox, or imageshack.

Then, post the link on the forum between tags.
If you use Imgur's BBCode link, you don't even need to put the img tags around it. Just copy and paste it as-is.

When you hit F1 to do a screencap, where does it save the pictures?

I cannot find the Screencaps folder anywhere. I've got the game installed in c:/program files/Kerbal

In that folder, there's the KSP.exe, and subfolders for Parts, Plugins, Game Data, Saves, etc. But there is no Screenshots folder. When I created a Screenshots folder, it didn't save any screencaps to it. So where are they going?
My screenshots folder was created in the KSP_win folder. However my directory structure is c:\Kerbal, though I have no idea if that could be the difference.

You go like this

If you want to upload a KSP image, just look for it in your screenshots folder.

It comes out like this:

Daddy look its a butterfly!

Upload it here or some other site like above: http://tinypic.com/

upload it, click to see full size image, right click on the image and open link in new tab. The url you need is in that tab.

Asking again because I cannot figure this one out.

Where is the Screenshots folder?????????

I just installed .20.2. In the zip file to install the game, there is no Screenshots folder. I gather that the game is supposed to create one when I first hit F1 to do a screenshot. But it's not.

Could it be creating the directory somewhere else? Is it a problem that I put the game in c:/program files/kerbal instead of just making it c:/kerbal? I am thoroughly confused about this. It's not a big deal, but it's bugging me, because nobody else who answered in the other thread I posted about this seems to be having a problem, except for me.

You definitely do not want the game in your program files from what I have read. It does cause issues, but not what you are describing from what I hear.

The screenshots folder should be in your KSP folder where the executable or application is.
I use the Snipping Tool within Win 7 to take the picture :-)
